Sentencas: To study possible failure modes of the Hexis Galileo solid oxide fuel cell stack, various stack components such as nickel/yttria stabilised zirconia anodes, lanthanum strontium manganese cathodes, 3 mol%-yttria stabilised zirconia electrolytes and chromium alloy metallic interconnectors have been characterised with respect to their thermo-mechanical properties.
Titulo: Simulation and Validation of Thermo-mechanical Stresses in Planar SOFCs

Sentencas: Specifically, coefficients of thermal expansion, Young's moduli, bending strengths, Poisson's ratios and fracture toughnesses have been measured.
Titulo: Simulation and Validation of Thermo-mechanical Stresses in Planar SOFCs

Sentencas: Furthermore, the temperature-dependent warpage of complete cells has been investigated by video analysis.
Titulo: Simulation and Validation of Thermo-mechanical Stresses in Planar SOFCs

Sentencas: All experimental data were taken as input parameters for a set of finite element models to analyse various thermo-mechanical phenomena on different length scales.
Titulo: Simulation and Validation of Thermo-mechanical Stresses in Planar SOFCs

Sentencas: The simulations offer an explanation for the often observed 'saddle-like` deformations of cells at room temperature.
Titulo: Simulation and Validation of Thermo-mechanical Stresses in Planar SOFCs

Sentencas: They also show that cracks that first develop within the anode induce local tensile stresses within the electrolyte and hence represent a weakening mechanism for the cells.
Titulo: Simulation and Validation of Thermo-mechanical Stresses in Planar SOFCs

Sentencas: It is shown that the induced electrolyte stresses depend on the anode crack density.
Titulo: Simulation and Validation of Thermo-mechanical Stresses in Planar SOFCs

Sentencas: The electrolyte stresses decrease as the distances between the anode cracks become smaller.
Titulo: Simulation and Validation of Thermo-mechanical Stresses in Planar SOFCs
